com.github.mibac138.argparser.reader

Interface ArgumentReader

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EmptyArgumentReader, ReaderArgumentReader, StringArgumentReader

    public ArgumentReader

    Interface for reading arguments. Can be implemented to read from various sources as just a plain string or files

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getAvailableCount()
      Returns guaranteed amount of text you can safely read at the moment
      int getLength()
      Returns the sum of already read text length and ArgumentReader.getAvailableCount. Might not return actual full text length until ArgumentReader.hasNext returns false
      boolean hasNext()
      Returns true if the underlying source can read more characters, false otherwise
      void mark()
      Marks current position in case there's a possibility you will need to go back
      char next()
      Returns next character from the underlying source
      java.lang.String read(int count)
      Reads count next characters and returns them
      boolean removeMark()
      Removes last mark (doesn't return to it)
      boolean reset()
      Removes last mark and returns to it
      void skip(int count)
      Skips count characters.

    • Method Detail

      • skip

        void skip(int count)

        Skips count characters.

        Parameters:
        count - amount of characters meant to be skipped
        Throws:
        - if underlying source isn't long enough

      • read

        java.lang.String read(int count)

        Reads count next characters and returns them

        Returns:
        string of length count
        Throws:
        - if underlying source isn't long enough

      • hasNext

        boolean hasNext()

        Returns true if the underlying source can read more characters, false otherwise

        Returns:
        whether you can read safely read more characters (at least 1)

      • next

        char next()

        Returns next character from the underlying source

        Throws:
        - if is empty

      • getLength

        int getLength()

        Returns the sum of already read text length and ArgumentReader.getAvailableCount. Might not return actual full text length until ArgumentReader.hasNext returns false

        See Also:
        ArgumentReader.getAvailableCount, ArgumentReader.hasNext

      • getAvailableCount

        int getAvailableCount()

        Returns guaranteed amount of text you can safely read at the moment

      • mark

        void mark()

        Marks current position in case there's a possibility you will need to go back

      • removeMark

        boolean removeMark()

        Removes last mark (doesn't return to it)

        Returns:
        true if removed mark, false otherwise (usually means no marks left)

      • reset

        boolean reset()

        Removes last mark and returns to it

        Returns:
        true if removed mark and returned, false otherwise (usually means no marks left)
